en.level_11_1: We found another treasure! This time it's under the ground!
en.level_11_2: Come on kid let's get our hands dirty!
en.devide_level_bomb: You hit a bomb! Try again to collect all the coins without clicking on bomb.
en.intro_uwt_level_1: Hey kid, we found a treasure under the water!
en.intro_uwt_level_2: The bad news is we can only carry 4 gold coins with combined value of 20.
en.intro_uwt_level_3: So you should collect this 4 coins, which combined value is 20. Good luck!
en.uwt_level_success: Great! So 20 is equal to 4 groups of 5, which means that 20 = 4 * 5
en.uwt_level_fail: We can carry coins with combined value of 20! You collected more! Click to try again!
en.equation_level_1_1: We need to prepare the ship sails in order to sail away.
en.equation_level_1_2: Drag the numbers to the correct empty spots to express the given equation.
en.equation_level_1_3: Now click on the unknown symbol and select the number that solves the equation.
en.equation_level_1_4: Great job kid! We can now sail away!
en.equation_level_1_equation_text: How many groups of 10 are there in 50?
en.equation_level_2_1: Great! We can continue our trip. Let us prepare the sails again.
en.equation_level_2_2: Drag the numbers to the correct empty spots to express the given equation.
en.equation_level_2_3: Now click on the unknown symbol and select the number that solves the equation.
en.equation_level_2_4: Excellent! We can now continue the treasure hunt!
en.equation_level_2_equation_text: How many groups of 7 do we need to get 21 in total?
en.level_8_5: Once you are done hit the OK button.
en.level_7_explain_6: Click on two objects with the same value to combine them into a bigger object.
en.make_equation_2: Make an equation from the statement: How many groups of 5 are there in 45? Drag the coins to the empty places.
en.divide_level_12: Click on the coins until their value reaches 4. Then click to collect them.
en.level_1_4: Of course, if you do a good job you will have a share!
en.level_9_3: You will have to repair one more ship, so we can take the treasure home.
en.level_7_explain_2: To be fair we have a pirate tradition when splitting the treasure.
en.level_8_6: The first task is to build a mast 2 times HIGHER than the BLUE one.
en.level_8_1: We are ready to go! ... Oh, no! The ship is damaged! We can't leave!
en.divide_level_8: Click on the coins until their value reaches 5. Then click to collect them.
en.picm_12_1: Great job! This means 12 can be split into 4 groups of 3.
en.picm_16_3: 4 and 4 are called factors and 16 is called the product.
en.level_9_8: The last one should be 2 times LOWER than the YELLOW one.
en.level_8_7: Now build a mast 3 times HIGHER than the BLUE one.
en.level_7_explain_1: It's time to finally get your share of the treasure.
en.divide_level_13: Thanks, kid! So 64 divided by 4 equals 16.
en.level_1_2: My name is Josh and I am a professional pirate.
en.divide_level_4: Click on the coins until their value reaches 6. Then click to collect them.
en.level_8_4: Use the up button to increase and the down button to decrease the mast height.
en.make_equation_1: Make an equation from the statement: How many groups of 6 are there in 24? Drag the coins to the empty places.
en.level_10_3: You better stick with the lessons! Good-bye Captain!
en.level_7_explain_8: The last roll, do your best!
en.level_10_1: Well, kid, you learned how to dig a treasure and be rich!
en.picm_10_1: Great job! This means 10 can be split into 2 groups of 5.
en.picm_16_1: Great job! This means 16 can be split into 4 groups of 4.
en.picm_err: Coins should be distributed evenly between the chests! Try again!
en.divide_level_10: 45 is called the dividend, 5 is called the divisor, and 9 is called the quotient.
en.divide_level_15: Thanks! My crew will be so happy! They like pizza! Do you like it too?
en.picm_6_1: Great job! This means 6 can be split into 3 groups of 2.
en.level_1_3: I found a big treasure! Will you help me dig for it? I am too old for that.
en.level_9_5: Now make the mast 2 times LOWER than the BLUE mast.
en.picm_6_3: 3 and 2 are called factors and 6 is called the product.
en.level_9_1: Oh hey kid, it's me again. No no, I didn't lose the keys to my ship.
en.level_9_9: Nicely done Captain! Our job here is done!
en.buttons_instr_2: Press left mouse button to collect the coin.
en.level_7_explain_3: First, you roll a dice and it shows a group of how many coins you get.
en.divide_level_14: 64 is called the dividend, 4 is called the divisor, and 16 is called the quotient.
en.level_9_6: This one should be 3 times HIGHER than the RED one.
en.picm_9_3: 3 and 3 are called factors and 9 is called the product.
en.divide_level_5: Great job! So 24 divided by 6 equals 4.
en.picm_9_1: Great job! This means 9 can be split into 3 groups of 3.
en.level_8_3: I am sure you can do it!
en.level_8_9: Build a mast 2 times LOWER than the WHITE one.
en.level_7_explain_9: Awesome! You are rich now! ...I am kidding, it's just a game haha!
en.level_7_explain_7: I will give you one more roll because I am a nice guy.
en.divide_level_3: Would you help me find how many groups of 6 there are in 24?
en.level_7_explain_5: So if you roll 4 and 2, it means you will get 2 groups of 4 coins.
en.divide_level_11: Finally, how many cakes can I buy with 64 coins? One cake cost 4 coins.
en.level_1_1: Hey there! Welcome to the Treasure Island!
en.divide_level_2: I can spend 24 coins on pizzas. Each pizza costs 6 coins. How many can I buy?
en.buttons_instr_1: Move left or right with the mouse.
en.picm_10_3: 2 and 5 are called factors and 10 is called the product.
en.make_equation_3: Make an equation from the statement: How many groups of 4 are there in 64? Drag the coins to the empty places.
en.divide_level_7: I would also like to buy soda cans for 45 coins. Each can cost 5 coins.
en.level_7_explain_4: Then you roll another dice to tell you how many groups you will have.
en.divide_level_1: Nice! I made a lot of money! I want to buy some pizzas for my crew.
en.level_9_4: Start by doing a mast 3 times LOWER than the BLUE one.
en.level_8_8: The next one should be 5 times HIGHER than the BLUE one.
en.picm_1: Distribute all of the coins evenly between the chests by dragging them.
en.level_8_11: Well done Captain! We can now sail away!
en.picm_12_3: 4 and 3 are called factors and 12 is called the product.
en.divide_level_9: Great job! So 45 divided by 5 equals 9.
en.level_9_7: Now build the mast 4 times HIGHER than the GREEN one.
en.picm_8_3: 4 and 2 are called factors and 8 is called the product.
en.level_8_10: The last one should be 2 times LOWER than the RED one.
en.level_10_2: Just kidding, it only happens in video games.
en.level_8_2: We need to build the masts. I would help you, but my back hurts.
en.level_9_2: It turns out the treasure is too much for a single ship.
en.divide_level_6: 24 is called the dividend, 6 is called the divisor, and 4 is called the quotient.
en.picm_8_1: Great job! This means 8 can be split into 4 groups of 2.
